name: Málaga Scala User Group
description:
Scala es un lenguaje de programación orientado a objetos y, a la vez, un lenguaje funcional. La combinación de estos dos paradigmas hace especialmente atractiva la programación con Scala, y lo convierte en un lenguaje idóneo para la programación paralela y distribuida. Además, Scala ejecuta sobre la máquina virtual de Java. 

Este grupo se ha creado con el propósito de compartir experiencias sobre Scala y las distintas tecnologías que forman parte de su ecosistema: frameworks de desarrollo Web como Play o Lift, la infraestructura de middleware basada en actores Akka, frameworks de prueba BDD como Scalatest o Specs, etc.

Si te gusta programar y estás interesado en las técnicas más novedosas como la type-level computation, macros para lenguajes estáticamente tipados, etc., te gustará Scala. Y si estás interesado en las últimas tecnologías para el desarrollo de aplicaciones empresariales (programación basada en actores, sistemas orientados a eventos, etc.), no lo dudes, Scala te va a encantar. Únete a nuestro grupo, aprende y comparte con nosotros tus experiencias con Scala.

Consulta nuestro código de conducta.

name: Scala Developers in Manchester
description:
All skill levels of Scala developers are welcome, we are a bunch of Scala Develops, Scala enthusiasts and Scala Noobs.  

There are a range of talks for the beginer to the pro, there is something for everyone.

We are meet on the last Monday of the Month at Mad Lab, come along and chat!

name: ScalaMAD: Scala Programming @ Madrid
description: Scala es un lenguaje de programación orientado a objetos y, a la vez, un lenguaje funcional. La combinación de estos dos paradigmas hace especialmente atractiva la programación con Scala, y lo convierte en un lenguaje idóneo para la programación paralela y distribuida. Si además estás interesado en los lenguajes específicos de dominio (DSLs), encontrarás en Scala un candidato ideal para implementar tu DSL de manera embebida. Además, ¡Scala ejecuta sobre la máquina virtual de Java! Este grupo se ha creado con el propósito de compartir experiencias sobre Scala y las distintas tecnologías que forman parte de su ecosistema: frameworks de desarrollo Web como Play o Lift, la infraestructura de middleware basada en actores Akka, frameworks de prueba BDD como Scalatest o Specs, etc. Si te gusta programar y estás interesado en las técnicas más novedosas como la type-level computation, macros para lenguajes estáticamente tipados, etc., te gustará Scala. Y si estás interesado en las últimas tecnologías para el desarrollo de aplicaciones empresariales (programación basada en actores, sistemas orientados a eventos, etc.), no lo dudes, Scala te va a encantar. Únete a nuestro grupo, aprende y comparte con nosotros tus experiencias con Scala.

name: Scala Lyon User Group
description: Le Scala Lyon User Group, #slug, se réunit régulièrement depuis janvier 2014 pour échanger autour de Scala et de son écosystème. Que tu sois juste curieux ou que tu fasses du Scala depuis 10 ans, tu es le bienvenu. Tout le monde est invité à proposer des sujets et à venir donner son avis. Quelques sujets abordés depuis janvier : REX playframework/akka, Implémentation des collections scala, Typeclasses, SBT.

name: South West Scala
description:
South West Scala is a free Bristol-based informal meetup group for all practical things related to the Scala language.

If you use Scala for fun or profit, or just want to know more, come along to our next meetup.

Everybody welcome. Our members have backgrounds in many mainstream computer languages.

organizer.name: Mark Hudson
organizer.bio: Currently mostly interested in Graph databases, functional programming with JS, AngularJS and Node. Also work with C# and scala.

name: Scala Stockholm
description:
Scala Stockholm är en lokal grupp inom Scala Sverige som kommunicerar via http://groups.google.com/group/scala-sverige

På våra gruppträffar belyser vi programmeringsspråket Scala på olika sätt.

Scala Stockholm träffas lite då och då för att prata och koda Scala. Allra första träffen hölls i samband med Jfokus 2008, men då var vi inte särskilt många... Nu är vi uppe och har haft några träffar under 2010.

Vi blandar föredrag och kata-kodning. Förslag på teman är mycket välkomna.

name: Delhi NCR Scala Meetup
description: This is a group for anyone interested in Scala, functional programming, Akka, Machine Learning using Scala, NLP using Scala, Play / Lift Web Framework etc. All skills levels are welcome. I started this group to meet other Scala enthusiasts. Looking forward to explore the fascinating world of Scala ecosystem!

name: Scala Thailand Meetup
description: Scala Thailand Meetup is a group for everyone who interested in computer language name Scala can share the knowledges and experience of using Scala or relative frameworks to other group's member and furthermore, to present Scala in public for other people who do not know Scala but love coding through our free presentation for student in collect or university in Thailand and this is the reason why we use the name "Scala Thailand Meetup" not "Scala Bangkok Meetup".

name: Santiago Scala Meetup
description: Este es un grupo para los fanáticos de Scala, tecnologías relacionadas y lenguajes de programación funcionales. Si te interesa formar parte del primer grupo de Scala de Chile, quieres conocer a personas que comparten tu interés por Scala y programación funcional no dudes en unirte a nuestro grupo. Organizaremos meetups para compartir nuestra experiencia y conocimiento. Si eres un experto en Scala, tienes algo de experiencia o estas dando tus primeros pasos, estas cordialmente invitado a formar parte de este grupo !

organizer.name: Daniel Riquelme
organizer.bio: I have a startup that sells a Business Intelligence platform to Retail Suppliers. This software is based on PostgreSQL and is hosted on AWS.

name: Scala Moscow
description:
Scala Moscow is a group of Scala users interested in learning, applying and promoting Scala language and related technologies and solutions.

You already use Scala? This group is for you.
You are new to Scala? Join us and get introduced into this brilliant piece of technology.
 You are a Scala professional and have something to share? Please contact one of the organizers and present a technical talk!

name: SF Scala
description:
SF Scala is a group for functional programmers who use Scala to dominate the world. We build APIs, Big Data flows, and startups powered by Scala.  We do more with less people and less resoucres due to Scala's incredible power.  We meet to discuss best practices and how the technology is being used successfully by organizations.

SF Scala covers San Francisco, and events are coordinated with , which covers the peninsula and south bay.

If you would like to present a technical talk about Scala, or how Scala is used in your organization, please contact one of the organizers.  If you want to host, contact us.  We also are always looking for video sponsors to continue our recordings.

Always find us at sfscala.org and follow us on Twitter at @sfscala.

name: Scala Hamburg
description: Bei Scala Hamburg dreht sich alles um das Thema Scala und die daran anknüpfenden Bereiche wie Akka, Play, Lift, SBT, etc. Bei den regelmäßig stattfindenden Treffen können aber auch Themen wie Functional Programming, Massively Parallel Computing oder die Zukunft der JVM Sprachen im Allgemeinen diskutiert werden. Kurz und knapp: Hier treffen sich Scala Enthusiasten aus dem nord-deutschen Raum um sich zum Thema Scala auszutauschen, Kontakte zu knüpfen und Erfahrungen zu teilen.

name: Scala SB
description:
This is a meetup for Scala enthusiasts in the Santa Barbara area. We welcome everyone from newbies to experts. Meetups will hopefully cover a variety of topics ranging from the Scala language, to related frameworks (such as Play and Lift), to more philosophical discussions about the benefits and pitfalls of functional programming as a concept. We will meet up monthly (usually in downtown SB) for an open forum as well as presentations. Punch and pie will be served.

If you are interested in doing a presentation, please contact one of the organizers!

name: Scala Meetup Montevideo
description:

Si bien nuestro interés principal es el lenguaje Scala, también son bienvenidos todos aquellos interesados en la programación moderna en general, lenguajes alternativos en la JVM y la JVM.

 

Los esperamos a todos!

name: Toronto Scala & Typesafe User Group
description:
The Toronto Scala & Typesafe User Group is a great place to learn about the Scala language as well as Typesafe products that run on the JVM.  If you would like to learn more about the Play! Framework, Akka, Spark, functional programming, the reactive paradigm,  and other progressive technologies and ideas then you've come to the right place.

There are many shops in Toronto making the transition to Scala and even more using Typesafe technologies.  Lets meet up to discuss techniques, share what we've learned, answer questions, and develop best practices. All skill levels are welcome.

description: This group is for people who are interested in functional programming with Scala and Akka actors. While the focus of this group will be to discuss functional programming aspects of Scala, but we can discuss anything related to Scala/Akka stack.

next_event.name: Discuss Scala Akka and Related Technologies

name: Riviera Scala Clojure
description:
La programmation fonctionnelle prend de plus en plus d'ampleur ces dernières années. Beaucoup disent que c'est une nécessité, le paradigme étant simplement plus adapté aux architectures massivement parallèles, distribuées ou pour employer un buzz word, au cloud.

Mais c'est plus que cela. Scala et Clojure sont des langages élégants, modernes, expressifs et avant tout  fun à utiliser. Basés sur la JVM, ils sont ouverts sur le monde. Ils s’intègrent dans n'importe quelle application Java existante et bénéficient des API et frameworks existants.

Ils sont aussi étrangers. Même si beaucoup d'entre nous ont étudié les possibilités de tels langages lors de nos études, nous voyons l'informatique via le prisme du tout orienté objet, du séquentiel, de la programmation impérative.

Sans vouloir rejeter ce que nous connaissons déjà, ce groupe a pour but d'apprendre. Il s'agit de curiosité intellectuelle, du plaisir de programmer, d'essayer de nouvelles choses.

Si vous aussi avez l'envie d'apprendre, si vous aussi, vous vous intéressez aux dernières tendances en informatique… Enfin si vous aimez programmer, rejoignez le Riviera Scala Clojure group !

Via une réunion mensuelle dans un cadre convivial et à une mailing list, nous vous promettons des discussions enrichissantes, des présentations sur les concepts clefs de la programmation Scala/Clojure… Et bien sûr, du code !

Suivez nous sur twitter: @riviera_func

Et surtout ... Rejoignez le groupe meetup !

(Pensez de regarder vos "spam" pour l'email de confirmation du meetup)

 

 

English version:

Who can ignore an important progress of functional programming lately?  You may have also heard that functional programming is more adapted to multi-core, parallel, easier to reason with, supported in the cloud, and all those buzz words you may have heard from functional programming evangelists.

But it is more than those things. Scala and Clojure are two languages modern, expressive, and most of all fun to work with. The fact that these two languages target JVM has opened an important horizon of adoption.

Despite of its popularity, the discipline of functional programming and the programming languages may not be that straight forward, especially with the hegemony of object oriented programming in the software engineering.

We don't intend to completely replace our knowledge with new one..., no, no, no. We just want to open new horizon, new challenges, to write better software, and we're convinced that Scala / Clojure are the right tool to do so.

The program of this group consists of monthly friendly, informal meet-up where we can discuss codes, latest news, presentation.

Follow us at twitter: @riviera_func

But, most of all, Join us Here, in this Meetup Group

(Make sure you check the spam folder for meetup confirmation email )

name: Dubai Scala
description: loves Scala! A meeting for the startup founders and engineers leveraging Scala. We meet to discuss best practices and how the technology is being used successfully by organizations. While this group is for professional Scala programmers, beginners are welcome.

Anyone interested in being a Scala practitioner is welcome, whether devoted or just intrigued, professional or amateur. Likely topics include language and library details, tools, programming techniques, the big frameworks like Play and Akka, and perhaps even a little Spark.

name: Rio Scala Enthusiasts
description:
O objetivo deste grupo é promover, ensinar e aprender a linguagem de programação Scala e tecnologias relacionadas:

  • Fundamentos de FP (quem sabe OO também?)
  • web: Play Framework, Scalatra
  • Akka

Portanto, se está interessado em programação funcional ou Scala, venha nos encontrar.

Se você tem uma sugestão de tópico deixa-a logo abaixo, no "+" acima da lâmpada.

Para quem está em SP recomendo Scaladores.

English:

Promote, teach and learn the Scala object-functional programming language.

name: Dublin Scala Users Group
description:
Scala is a type-safe, object-functional programming language that has grown increasingly popular in the last few years thanks to its versatility and elegance. Organized by technologists from Gilt--an enthusiastic user of Scala since 2011--the Dublin Scala Users Group hosts technical presentations and workshops on the Typesafe platform (Scala, the Play framework, and Akka), functional programming, and other relevant topics. Join us for beer, networking, and talks on this fantastic (and fun!) language.


For articles on Scala, check out our tech blog: http://tech.gilt.com/

name: Warsaw Scala Enthusiasts
description:
Warszawa Scala Enthusiasts meetup is the home for the Scala Community in Warsaw, Poland and around.

The goal of this group is to meet and practice our understanding of Scala - a Functional and Object-Oriented Programming Language on Java Virtual Machine - in a comfortable, respectful and friendly environment.

No knowledge assumed. No previous attempts to Scala expected. With the other people in the group, anyone can quickly get up to speed with Scala and functional programming.

We'll meet every two weeks in person and on Google Hangouts.

Meetups are usually held at Javeo on Wednesdays biweekly.

twitter: @WarszawaScala and we use the hashtag #scalapl

Discussions at http://groups.google.com/group/scalania

name: Rhein-Main Scala Enthusiasts
description:
A Meetup about the Scala language and its ecosystem in the region of Darmstadt/Frankfurt.

We may cover subjects as:

- Discovering the language itself (language constructs, core libraries, ...),
- Web frameworks (Play2, Lift, …)
- Akka,
- Typesafe stack,
- Functional programming principles,
- Study groups related to Coursera classes on FP and reactive programming,
- Study groups related to the book “functional programming in Scala” or scala koans,
- Experience and knowledge sharing from developers, startups or established entreprises,
- Job offers,
- scalaz and other hardcore stuff ;)
- … you name them

So whether you’re a beginner, a seasoned developer or a business person interested in Scala join us and let us know if you have great ideas for meetups or want to give talks!

next_event.name: "Your microservice as a Function" with Phil Calcado

name: Torino Scala Programming & Big Data Meetup
description: Questo gruppo è per tutti coloro che usano abitualmente o vogliono imparare il linguaggio di programmazione Scala e affacciarsi nel mondo dei big data. La natura scalabile dei linguaggi funzionali sta trainando il mondo dello sviluppo web e dei big data e Scala propone un mix di robustezza, flessibilità e produttività davvero interessante per moltissimi campi di applicazione. Gli incontri toccheranno vari temi dalle basi del linguaggio alle applicazioni più spinte nel campo dei big data ( apache spark ): analytics e machine learning. L'Italia sta scoprendo solo ora il mondo dei Big Data ed è quindi importante prepararsi alle sfide del prossimo decennio.

name: Scala User Group - Aarhus (SUGA)
description: This is a group for anyone interested in the Scala programming language, the play web framework, Akka, JVM languages, functional programming etc. Meetups will be placed in denmark and often in the city Aarhus in Jutland. All skills levels are welcome!. We are starting this group because we think that Scala is not getting the attention in denmark that we think it should! And if you are a startup we will love to help you adopt Scala and benefit from all the great things in the language. Typesafety is a great win, when your startup takes off. Looking forward to explorer all the great features of Scala with everybody. Come and join us :-)

name: Amman Scala
description: loves Scala! A meeting for the startup founders and engineers leveraging Scala. We meet to discuss best practices and how the technology is being used successfully by organizations.

name: Scala Bug Bash
description:
Scala Bug Bash is a programming meetup that helps the Scala open-source community by coordinating the efforts of software developers in and around NYC.

This meetup is for software engineers (no recruiters :) who want to give back to the Scala community by contributing patches to open-source projects. We all stand on the shoulders of giants; existing projects like unfiltered and kafka and scalding, to name just a few, allow us to build {more,better,faster} systems. Helping open source helps all of us. It's also a great way to meet other like-minded people and to improve as a developer.

At the meetup itself, we work together to help these projects by fixing bugs, adding documentation, and adding features. So bring a laptop and come ready to write some code!

name: Florianópolis Scala Functional Language Meetup
description:
Florianópolis’ Scala language enthusiasts group.  We are interested in innovative application development and knowledge sharing about Scala programming language.

Grupo de entusiastas da linguagem de programação Scala de Florianópolis para o desenvolvimento de aplicações inovadoras e a troca de conhecimentos.

name: PHASE: Philly Area Scala Enthusiasts
description:
The Philly Area Scala Enthusiasts (PHASE) is a user group for people in the Philadelphia, PA, area who are interested in the Scala programming language. If you're interested in Scala, programming on the Java VM, or functional programming in general, feel free to join us.

NOTE: This group is for Scala discussions only. Emails or posts that are not Scala-related may get you banned from the group.

organizer.name: Brian Clapper
organizer.bio: I'm an independent software consultant and President of ArdenTex, Inc. I have 30 years' experience developing software, including large-scale systems. Additional info is at www.ardentex.com.

name: Ljubljana Scala User Group

name: budapest.scala

name: Scala Stammtisch
description:
We believe that programming languages, like spoken languages, require a close-knit user community in order to thrive. Scala Stammtisch is founded to bring people together who want to learn, share, and improve functional programming in Scala.

According to Wikipedia, “A Stammtisch is an informal group meeting held on a regular basis, and also the usually large, often round table around which the group meets. A Stammtisch is not a structured meeting, but rather a friendly get-together.”

We are the Scala Stammtisch of NYC, and we invite you to the table.

Format

While most technical meetups optimize for one-to-many communication, Scala Stammtisch aims for 15-to-15 discussion of technical topics.

We discuss one topic in a month’s worth of weekly meetups. Three discussions of the same material repeat on a fixed schedule each week; members should plan to attend only one of these. A fourth gathering takes place in an even less structured, and potentially raucous, setting.

The first 3 meetups for a topic will have an RSVP limit of 15. We will take attendance and no-shows will not be tolerated in the group, though members may change their RSVP with impunity from the time of the announcement up until 12pm of the day of the meetup.

We try to have drink-ups once a month, but this can vary. Past drink-ups have been held on Murphy Ave. in Sunnyvale, and Castro in Mountain View.  So far, we have settled on Stein's Beer Garden, in Mountain View, as an optimal DrinkUp destination, but may try other locations along the CalTrain corridor (ranging from Palo Alto through San Jose).

I started this group to help people find their way past the large number of "implicit" hurdles which tend to confuse and/or stop those initially interested in diving into some Scala code. next_event.name: Around the track, again, we go!

description:
Dies ist eine Gruppe für alle, die daran interessiert sind reaktive Anwendungsentwicklung und ihre Facetten näher kennen zu lernen. Wir fokussieren dabei meist auf die Verwendung der Typesafe Reactive Platform, sowie auf die Nutzung der Programmiersprachen Scala und auch Java. Wir beleuchten dabei verschiedene Frameworks, wie Akka, Play, slick, spray, usw.

Es sind aber auch Beiträge zur reaktiven Softwareentwicklung auf anderen Plattformen willkommen (wie z.B.: der Microsoft Platform um C# und F#).

Wir treffen uns bei Firmen in der Pfalz (meist Mannheim, Neustadt an der Weinstraße, Kaiserslautern, ...)

This group aims to provide an engaging and thoughtful forum for discussing the ins and outs, ups and downs, pros and cons, successes and failures of applying Scala to real-world software engineering problems. All skill levels welcome. Prerequisites are: ability to listen, share, and engage, an open mind, and a passion for exploring new ways of creating software solutions.

name: Oakland advanced Scala Study Group
description:
The Oakland Advanced Scala Study Group was formed in May 2014 by Azad Bolour, Chris Richardson, and Bill Venners to promote the in-depth understanding of the Scala language and its ecosystem for developers serious about using Scala professionally.

If you are already familiar with Scala (for example, at the level of successful completion of the Coursera Functional Programming in Scala course) and are eager to take your knowledge to the next level, join us twice monthly in the East Bay for a lively discussion of timely topics in the advanced use of Scala.

For each study session, we choose a Scala topic of wide interest, recommend preparatory reading materials and things to try on your own, then get together to discuss, share ideas, and pair/group program to solidify our understanding of that topic for everyday professional use.

We look forward to your participation in our next meetup.

Azad, Chris, Bill

P.S.  Please keep in mind that study groups like this are most productive when everyone has taken the time to prepare for each meeting beforehand in order to develop a basic understanding of the topic areas and to formulate questions and issues for discussion.

The level and format is TBD, but is likely to be somewhat hands-on, and, if there are enough folks, perhaps fragmented into small interest groups. Some ideas: - introductory sessions for folks who are "kicking the tires" on Scala, maybe centered around a particular book or on-line resource. - a series of mutual-aid sessions revolving around the upcoming "Principles of Reactive Programming" course (for folks who already know some Scala). - introductions to specific libraries and frameworks; for instance, I'd be willing to do sessions on the reactive libraries I'm using: Dispatch (HTTP client), ReactiveMongo, and Play-Json.

name: Scala/Spark Real Time Analytics  Meetup
description: This is a meetup for people interested in performing real-time analytics using the Berkeley Data Analytics stack via the scala programming language. Berkeley Data Analytics stack (BDAS) is a set of software components optimised for performing real-time analytics on large datasets (Big Data). The most interesting components for data-analytics in the BDAS stack are Apache Spark and Apache Mesos. Apache Spark™ is a fast and general engine for large-scale data processing. (https://spark.apache.org/) Apache Mesos is a cluster manager that simplifies the complexity of running applications on a shared pool of servers. (http://mesos.apache.org/) Apache Cassandra is a distributed NoSQL data store. The Apache Cassandra database is the right choice when you need scalability and high availability without compromising performance. (http://cassandra.apache.org/) This meetup will hold discussions / sessions on the exciting new use cases in real time analytics made possible by BDAS. In addition, this group will also occasionally have discussions on the Scala programming language and functional programming. No prior scala experience required.

name: Boston Area Scala Enthusiasts
description:
Hi. This group was established in 2009. Anyone interested in the Scala programming language is welcome.

We meet at various locations in the Kendall Square neighborhood of Cambridge. Lately most meetings have been at MIT's Stata Center.

Meetings usually start at 6:30, include one or two talks or sessions, and conclude by 8:00; there is usually pizza and soda provided by a sponsor; and some of us usually go out for drinks and further conversation afterwards.

We'd love to hear from interested speakers and workshop leaders. Any length of talk is welcome, from 5 minutes to a whole meeting. The format is open; usually it's been talks with slides and/or live coding, but other formats like hands-on workshops and sessions are welcome too.

Meetings may be photographed and the photos posted to the group.

name: Underscore
description:
Underscore is the Israeli Scala community, striving to share knowledge between Israeli Scala users and promote the use of the language in local - and international - companies.

The Meetup group is intended to promote Scala-related events in Israel; you may also want to join our feed in Google Groups for general discussion and to meet fellow Scala developers in Israel.

organizer.name: Shai Yallin
organizer.bio: Software Philosopher

name: FP AMS
description:
FP AMS aims to bring together commercial users of functional programming. We want to support and promote functional technologies in the Dutch software industry.

Topics for future meetings could include,

  • Essentials of functional programming
  • Real world experiences with functional styles
  • Mixing functional code into existing imperative/OOP codebases
  • Functional programming language specifics: Scala, Haskell, F#, Erlang, Ocaml, Clojure, Scheme.
  • Functional idioms in non-functional languages
  • Concurrent, parallel and distributed computing in a functional style
  • Data visualisation, scientific programming, numerical methods, optimisation and GPUs.

name: Scaladores
description:
Scaladores é um grupo de usuários da linguagem Scala, criado para reuniões presenciais de desenvolvedores da região da cidade de São Paulo para discutir assuntos relacionados à linguagem.

Além do blog/site Scaladores, temos uma lista de discussão também: http://groups.google.com/group/scaladores.

Seja bem-vindo(a)!

organizer.name: Rodolfo Ferreira
organizer.bio: Web developer, open-source enthusiast. Loves building stuff that works. Big jazz/fusion and progressive music fan.

name: Informed Apps Group - Apps Using Big Data
description: Calling all innovators who live and breathe big data and the creating applications around that data. We will create interactive meetups for database gurus, programmers and product owners alike. Coding language is up to you. We have developers using Scala, PHP, Python and more as well as the frontend design and product specialists. Food, beverage and an interactive good time will be provided.

name: ScalaMDE
description:
El grupo tiene como propósito fomentar la adopción del lenguaje Scala, sus principios (programación funcional, inmutabilidad y demás) y tecnologías (akka, play, slick, spray y demás) 

Como objetivo perseguimos facilitar el aprendizaje y el debate en comunidad.

name: Mødegruppe for ƒunktionelle Københavnere
description:
Mødegruppe for ƒunktionelle Københavnere vil prøve på at få flere og flere software projekter til at tage udgangspunkt i funktionelle programmeringssprog.

Vi har primært fokus på F# og Haskell, men andre funktionelle programmeringssprog som Scala, Lisp, Erlang, Clojure, OCaml, osv. er mere end velkommen.

Vi forventer at mødes minimum 12 gange om året, hvis ikke flere, for at udveksle erfaringer ved bruget af de funktionelle programmeringssprog i software projekter som skulle være i/eller på vej til produktion.

In English:

Ƒunctional Copenhageners Meetup Group will try to get more and more software projects to be based on functional programming languages.

We mainly focus on F# and Haskell, but other functional programming languages ​​like Scala, Lisp, Erlang, Clojure, OCaml, etc. are more than welcome.

We expect to meet at least twelve times a year, if not more, to share experiences with regards of the use of functional programming languages ​​in software projects that are in / or heading to production.

name: Houston Functional Programmers
description: We are a group of programmers in Houston Texas interested in functional programming languages and methodologies including (but not limited to) Erlang, Clojure, Scala, Haskell, F# and others. We welcome people of all experience levels and backgrounds.

name: Ionic Web Development Idaho Falls
description: An Ionic Meet Up in Idaho Falls. This meet up provides the community with learning opportunities about web development using Ionic and other web development technologies. This group is aimed at those interested in AngularJS, Ionic, Cordova, Scala.js, Hybrid/Web App Development. All skill levels welcome. Join us for our next meet up!

name: HRScala
description: Come one, come all and join the wonderful world of Scala - let's meet up and discuss object-functional concoction we stirred up recently. We welcome Clojure, Groovy, Kotlin and other alternative JVM language aficionados. Working with Erlang or Haskell? Please teach us some forbidden arts! The purpose of this meetup is to exchange knowledge regarding tooling, runtime, scaling, deployment options and development tricks.

name: Thames Valley Functional Programming Meetup
description:
There is a growing faction of engineers working with or considering working with a functional language.
This group aims to foster and promote the various functional languages emerging.
Haskell, Scala, Lisp/Scheme, Erlang, F# et al are all included. Meetups will cover interesting techniques, patterns and use cases. Resources to help those interested make informed choices about how functional languages and techniques can deliver benefits to their developers and organization as a whole.

name: Hannover.FP
description: Purely functional. Architecture, development and programming in Clojure, Haskell, Common Lisp, Scala, Erlang, F#, and any other language that allows you to follow functional concepts.

name: Fun(Lx)
description:
For all FP enthusiasts, regardless of prior knowledge or language background. If you're curious about Haskell, Erlang, Clojure, Scala, Elixir and others, come share your experiences and learn from others!

Para todos os entusiastas de linguagens funcionais, seja qual for o nível de experiência neste ou noutros paradigmas. Se tiverem curiosidade em saber mais  ou partilhar os vossos conhecimentos sobre Haskell, Erlang, Clojure, Scala, Elixir e outras, juntem-se a nós!

organizer.name: João Duarte
organizer.bio:
Software engineer at Elasticsearch!
Interested in (J)Ruby, FP languages and all things Event Driven

name: Reykjavík Play! framework Meetup
description: Play! Framework er gríðarlega gott, forritaravænt umhverfi sem einfaldar vefsmíði í Java/Scala mikið. Hittu aðra vefsmiði á Íslandi til að deila þínum hugmyndum um Play!, Akka, Scala og Java og sjá hvernig aðrir eru að nota þessa tækni til að búa til vefi sem eru skalanlegir og reaktívir.

name: South Bay Functional Types
description:
• Are you a Software Engineer with an Intermediate to advanced background in Functional Programming? 

• Are you a Scala programmer whom would like to expand your understanding of the underlying Type  System and learn advanced libraries such as scalaz or shapeless?

• Are you eager to crack-open a copy of Types and Programming Languages or a text on Category Theory?

• Does imperative and/or mutable code make you nauseous?

• Perhaps you want to pick up some Haskell, Ocaml, or Idris along the way.

{ `We Are South Bay Functional Types` =>

2015 is here: and while we may not have any hover-boards or flying cars, we are a new study group in Silicon Valley with a common goal to learn more about FP, Programming Language Type Systems, and Category Theory (both theory and applications).

The plan is to meet once a month in a casual setting where we read through texts, compare notes on exercises, and write code over dinner/drinks.

Some background in functional programming, and the hunger to learn more are both highly recommended.

}

organizer.name: Ryan Delucchi
organizer.bio: I am a higher-kinded type of Scala Craftsman in San Jose building awesome stuff at Verizon OnCue.

name: ScalaLA
description: Interested in learning about Reactive applications? Founded by engineers at Cargomatic, this group is dedicated to providing the community with real-world examples of using Scala, Akka, and related technologies to create highly-concurrent distributed applications.

name: Lambda Jakarta
description:
Jika kalian tertarik dengan bahasa pemrograman, atau bahasa yang belum memiliki grup lokal seperti Erlang, Clojure, Go, F#, Rust, Haskell, OCaml, Racket, Scheme, LISP, SML, atau Scala, silakan bergabung!

Kami berusaha membantu orang-orang yang ingin belajar. Mudah-mudahan semua bisa mendapatkan teman belajar yang memiliki minat yang sama. Jika kalian sudah punya studi grup, kami juga bisa membantu kalian.

Jika ingin memberikan presentasi, saran tentang topik diskusi, jangan ragu untuk mengontak kami!


Pranala luar

• Mailing list publik

• Materi Clojure

• Materi Haskell


If you're interested in deeper understanding of programming languages, or any languages that do not have a local group yet like Erlang, Clojure, Go, F#, Rust, Haskell, OCaml, Racket, Scheme, LISP, SML, or Scala, then we're the group for you!

We are trying to accommodate people who want to learn. Hopefully, you can find people who share the same interest, and want to learn together. If you already have a proglang study group, we can help you too!

If you'd like to give a talk, or propose a discussion topic for a meeting, please contact us!

name: New York Scala University
description: A place for people to learn functional programming languages from experienced software engineers.

name: Bucharest Java User Group
description: Welcome! If you are a passionate developer using either Java, Scala, Groovy, Clojure, JRuby or any other language based on the JVM (Java Virtual Machine) you are in the right place. Our plan is to organise a monthly face to face meeting with 2-3 presentations starting around 7PM and later on move to a pub for drinks.

name: Prague Lambda Meetup
description:
This meetup group was created as a group for functional programming enthusiasts, programmers interested in different programming languages which support FP paradigm: Erlang, Clojure, Haskell, OCaml, Scala, Lisp, etc. and different FP related topics and techniques. Join us if you are interested in FP, you want to share some knowledge, you want to know smth/more about FP, you want to meet people who interested in FP. Let's make FP community. We would like to be community powered, which means members can suggest meetup formats, topics and so on. Any suggestions are welcome.

If you are especially interested in Scala multiparadigm programming language, we highly recommend you to join this http://www.meetup.com/czech-scala-enthusiasts/ awesome meetup group.

name: Bucharest FP
description:
This group is for people who want to learn more about functional programming by exposing themselves to novel ideas and concepts.

Participants are expected to have tinkered with at least one such programming language, such as Clojure (or other Lisp dialect), Scala, Haskell, Erlang, some ML variant, etc.

Don't expect (too many) introductory presentations about functional programming, though. We aim for intermediate to advanced topics, regardless of programming language choice.

name: Playframework Hamburg
description:
Play ist ein Full-Stack Framework zum produktiven Entwickeln zustandsloser, skalierbarer Webarchitekturen in Java oder Scala. Diese Gruppe richtet sich an alle Enthusiasten, Neulinge und Interessierte. Ob es nun  Play Entwickler in Scala oder Java sind, Nutzer von Play1 oder Play2, es geht um das gegenseitige Lernen und den Austausch. Auch JavaEE Architekten, die mal etwas neues kennenlernen wollen, sind willkommen :-)

http://www.playframework.com

name: Lambda Lounge Kraków
description: We're The Lambda Lounge. A group of functional or other esoteric programming languages and paradigms. Haskell, Common Lisp, Clojure, Scala...? You name it!

organizer.name: Konrad Malawski
organizer.bio:
Akka team @ Typesafe; 

Believing that: 
"Life is Study!" - Kintaro Oe (Golden Boy),
a programmer lives, codes and enjoys his passion.

next_event.name: Lambda the Ultimate Declarative - part I

name: Play! NYC
description: A group dedicated to learning and mastering the Play! web application framework. The group was started by engineers at Gilt to help foster and learn from the Play! and Scala communities in NYC. As we dived deeper into this amazing web framework, we wanted to be able to connect with other engineers in the NY area to share our experiences, evangelize, and learn. No matter if you're a Play! expert, a Scala beginner, or just interested in what makes this web framework different, Play! NYC is here to help you flourish.

organizer.name: Gilt Tech Events
organizer.bio: Gilt Tech Evangelist (tech.gilt.com)/@gilttech

name: Functional Brighton
description:
Functional Brighton is a Brighton, UK meetup group that aims to bring together people interested in functional programming. We hope that it will complement London-based groups (eg. the London Scala User Group, Hoodlums, F#unctional Londoners, etc.), giving Londoners an excuse for a trip to the seaside and Brightonians some relief from the train.

After the very well attended first meeting we've settled on the third Tuesday of the month for meetups. Unless announced otherwise, we'll meet at The Skiff at 7pm.

Topics for future meetings could include,

  • Essentials of functional programming
  • Real world experiences with functional styles
  • Mixing functional code into existing imperative/OOP codebases
  • Functional programming language specifics: Scala, Haskell, F#, Erlang, Ocaml, Clojure, Scheme
  • Functional idioms in non-functional languages
  • Static vs. dynamic typing
  • Concurrent, parallel and distributed computing in a functional style
  • Data visualisation, scientific programming, numerical methods, optimisation and GPUs.

name: Cleveland Scalawags
description: This group is for people who enjoy or want to know more about programming in Scala. Along the way, we'll also touch on other functional language such as Haskell, Clojure, ML. We'll meet in the Akron area which hopefully provides a good middle ground for Canton and Cleveland Scalaers as well.

next_event.name: Intro To Functional Programming with Scala

name: Reactive Application Programmers in Delhi NCR
description: Calling all Functional Programmers in New Delhi, Gurgaon, Noida to be part of this group. We focus on the new way of writing software with Scala, Akka, Clojure, Erlang and Haskell.

name: Go on Up: Programming with Golang
description: Are you currently writing or want to write code in Go? Are you building on top of Go platforms, or what you wish were Go platforms? Are you interested in comparative discussions about programming languages? Is composition versus inheritance keeping you up at night? Then this group is for you. Anyone who regularly programs is welcome, or those who want to learn how to program. This group won't be tailored to introductions to programming in general, though we may do occasional intro to programming talks. If you're into AngularJS, Ruby, Python, Scala, Erlang, or any other possibly eccentric programming, you're more than welcome here. If you're writing software in or near Davis, you're welcome here.

name: Functional Programming – Taipei
description:
Let's spread the ideas about functional programming and languages! Let's discuss about general principles as well as specific programming languages (Scala, Haskell, Clojure etc.). Let's see why this paradigm is so important today.

Topics that can be covered on our meetups:

• Progamming in Scala

• Scala Libraries (Akka, scalaz, shapeless, Scalatest, Scalacheck, Slick etc.)

• Programming in Haskell (typeclasses, monads, functors etc.)

• Other languages (Clojure, Erlang, Scheme, Lisp etc.)

• Reactive programming

• Big data & parallel (distributed) computation

Meetups are aimed on non-experts and beginners, focusing on practical usage rather than theory.

organizer.name: Jiri Jakes
organizer.bio: Software Enginner in Taipei interested in IT (functional programming) and outdoor activities.

name: Play! Framework Argentina User Group
description:
PlayFramework trae nuevos aires al desarrollo Web en Java y ahora en Scala.

Si estas cansado de ver muchos XML, mucha configuracion y de realizar mucho boilerplate, entonces este el framework que tenes que probar para realizar aplicaciones web.

Si queres aprender sobre Play! y comaprtir el tiempo con gente que esta interesada en el mismo tambien, sumate a este grupo. Vas a tener la oportunidad de aprender como utilizarlo y poder aplicarlo dia a dia para el desarrollo.

name: Big Data Hyderabad
description:
Welcome to the "Big Data Hyderabad" Meetup Group.

"Big Data Hyderabad" is a group for anyone interested in learning/sharing knowledge on all new exciting frameworks/technologies in area of Big data/NoSQL/Functional Programming languages like Hadoop, Spark, Cascading, Scalding, Pig, Kafka, Zookeeper, Scala, Akka, Play, NoSQL(HBase, MongoDB, CouchBase) etc. We are not limited by a particular framework/technology. 

Come and share the knowledge or discuss in the board if you want to tell us about a new framework/technology.

All skill levels are welcome. I started this group because to meet other Big-data crunchers. Looking forward to explore the Big-data technologies with you.”

Also don't forget to join (and invite your friends/colleagues) our Linkedin group (on below link)  to subscribe to meetup events, news, webinars, articles, jobs and quite a lot. Happy Journey in learning/sharing Big-data.

https://www.linkedin.com/groups/Big-Data-Apache-Spark-Users-8344258 

*The meetup events are free of cost as they are always and anyone can attend who share the same interest and interested in knowing about it more.

*Due to the interest, it has become the 2nd biggest Apache Spark Meetup group after "Bay Area Spark Meetup group" as per this link (http://spark.meetup.com/).

name: Mumbai Spark Meetup
description: This is a meetup for Mumbai/Navi Mumbai users of Spark (www.spark-project.org), the high-speed Python and Scala-based cluster programming framework. We'll also discuss other Spark-related projects, including the Hive-on-Spark port (Shark), and other new programming tools for big data. The meetup will include introductions to the various Spark features, case studies from current users, best practices for deployment and tuning, and future development plans.

name: Chicago Data Science & Engineering Meetup
description: The Chicago Data Science & Engineering Group focuses on learning and implementing techniques in data science, engineering, statistics, machine learning, and visualization. This is is a language agnostic group and all technologies and tools are welcome including Python, Scala, Hadoop, Spark, Clojure, R, etc. This is an open space for learning and sharing. Beginners welcome.

name: Coder Consortium
description: Programming, Software Engineering, Software Architecture, Software Design Patterns, Testing, JUnit, NUnit, Java, JavaScript, Clojure, Scala, Ruby, Python, C#, GoLang, Kotlin, Rails, Grails, NodeJS, Hadoop, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Edison, Linux, WIndows, OSX, Android, iOS, Concurrency, Beer, Food, Economics, Politics These are just a few of the things Coder Consortium has talked about over the years. We're a friendly and welcoming group of Software Programming enthusiasts who meet the first Thursday of each month and participate in presentations, workshops, tutorials, lightning talks, etc. Come on out and see for yourself!

name: Quito Lambda
description: Quito Lambda es un grupo de personas interesados en la programación funcional. Queremos conocer a más personas que compartan nuestro interés en la programación funcional en idiomas como Javascript, Clojure, Haskell, Erlang o Scala. Únete a nosotros y comparte tus experiencias usando lenguajes funcionales y aprende de los demás.

organizer.name: Justin S. Leitgeb
organizer.bio: Haskell and Ruby programmer. Founder and CTO of Stack Builders, a software consultancy in NYC and Quito.

name: Dave Briccetti’s Young Programmers
description:
Computer programming sessions for young programmers in grades 3–12, in or near Lamorinda (Lafayette, Moraga, Orinda), run by experienced software developer and teacher Dave Briccetti. Sessions usually consist of instruction, coding time, and a lot of collaboration and learning from each other. Kids will bring a laptop, and learn to program computers using environments or languages like Tynker, Scratch, Python, Scala and JavaScript. Some sessions will be free, but most will have a fee for the instructor’s time (and sometimes room rental). For kids-only sessions (most of them), parents may observe if space permits.

For a sample of possible topics, and to see the instructor in action, see his YouTube channel.

Some sessions will take place over Google+ Hangouts. Join the Young Programmers community if you are interested in these.

organizer.name: Dave Briccetti
organizer.bio: Software developer in Scala, Java, Python and JavaScript, and programming teacher for kids. TalkingPuffin open source Scala Twitter client developer. Mediocre french horn and keyboard player. htttp://davebsoft.com

name: Tulsa Java Developers Group
description: We are a group of developers interested in continuous learning. We discuss anything related to the craft of software development as it pertains to Java and the JVM. Our topics range from basic Java for beginners to Java on embedded systems. We cover related languages such as SCALA, Groovy, Jython and frameworks such as Grails. Each month we have a meeting with food and a presentation on a topic of interest to our members. Come see what we're all about.

name: Apache Spark in Moscow
description:
This is a meetup for users of Spark (http://spark.apache.org), the high-speed cluster programming framework. We will discuss Spark-related projects, including Spark SQL, MLlib, GraphX, Scala and Spark Streaming. The meetup includes introductions to the various Spark features, case studies from users, best practices for deployment and tuning, and updates on development. 

Join us to learn more about how Spark can change your environment and development time.

name: All Things Technology !
description:
"We talk Java, we talk Ruby, we talk Scala, we talk js, we talk Python, we talk R, we talk Julia, we talk Java Script, we talk BigData, we talk Data science, we talk Devops, we talk Agile, we talk... All Things Technology !

and we serve good food and drinks!

Who funds us? Visit www.xebia.in "

name: Functional Phoenix
description: Developer Group for Functional Languages (F#, Haskell, Clojure, Erlang, Scheme, Scala, Lisp, etc...) and Programming paradigms in PHX. 7PM 4th Mon at UAT,rm 201

organizer.name: Hafthor
organizer.bio: Java, C#, SQL, iPhone, node.js Developer. User group junkie.

name: Apache Hadoop,Apache SPARK, Big Data Governance using Scala
description: Este es un grupo para todos los interesados en el uso de grandes volúmenes de información usando tecnologías de computo distribuido y tolerante a fallos.

name: Hamburg Akka Meetup
description:
Akka is a toolkit and runtime for building highly concurrent, distributed, and fault tolerant event-driven applications on the JVM. 

The Hamburg Akka Meetup is a place for anyone interested in Akka. It does not matter if you are using it with Java or Scala, if you use it in production or in pet projects, or even not at all yet, if you have years of experience or only just learned about it. Please join us to discuss the possibilities of actor based, message driven applications, Akka's features such as clustering, persistence, reactive streams, Akka design patterns, real world experience, testing, monitoring, anything!


Deutsche Version:

Das Hamburg Akka Meetup ist für alle offen, die sich für Akka interessieren! Es spielt keine Rolle, ob du es produktiv einsetzt und nur in Hobby-Projekten, oder noch gar nicht. Ob du schon jahrelange Erfahrung hast, oder gerade erst zum ersten Mal davon gehört. Auch nicht, ob du die Java- oder die Scala-API benutzt.

Mach mit, diskutiere die Möglichkeiten von Aktorensystemen, Akkas Features wie Cluster, Persistenz, "Reactive Streams", Akka Entwurfsmuster, Praxisbericht, Testen, Monitoring, alles weitere..

name: Omaha Java Users Group
description:
Omaha's Java and JVM User Group. For Java Professionals of all languages and frameworks that run in the JVM including Java, Groovy, Grails, Scala, Clojure, JRuby, Android, Javascript, etc. We also cover enterprise and web dev topics such as architecture, testing, security, and scalability. Promoting the Java community, supporting each other, sharing some pizza, and hanging out to socialize after the meetings! 
http://ojug.org/
@omahajug

Please join our Google Groups mailing list too! https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/omaha-java-users-group

name: Miami JVM Group
description: Wanted to meet with other fellow programmers/managers who are focus on the java or the JVM. A group where we can discuss programming languages (Groovy, Clojure, Scala, JRuby, Android, etc), frameworks (Spring, Struts, Hibernate, JPA, Play, etc), and tools (Jenkins, Jira, Tomcat, IDE, etc) as well as a place to talk about personal experiences or learn new things Developers, managers, and students are welcome!

organizer.name: Marcelo Olivas
organizer.bio: Software developer, manager, open-source aficionado, entrepreneur, agile fanatic, avid reader, crossfitter, a father, a husband, UM, and...a friendly Nicaraguan

next_event.name: Big Data Use Case (Hadoop/Spark) - Modernizing Medicine

name: Las Vegas Functional Programming User Group
description:
Let's get together and discuss functional programming! Clojure, Scala, Haskell, Ruby, Javascript and more. On a bi-weekly basis, we talk about how to use functional programming principles in our everyday code to make us more productive and help us ship quality code on time.

We emphasize practicality -- how to use the functional design patterns we learn to make our production code more robust and easier to reason about -- but occasionally we talk about stuff just because it's cool.

Programmers of all backgrounds are always welcome!

Our GitHub repo containing code from some of our talks is here https://github.com/LasVegasFunctionalProgrammingGroup/

organizer.name: Andrew Mohrland
organizer.bio: Programmer. UNLV Physics grad. Interested in distributed systems, data mining, and creating things people want.

name: PDXScala
description:
Come join other Scala fans, whether you're a seasoned old-timer or complete beginner. We'll have open discussions and a variety of presentations and examples. If you have topics you're interested in hearing more about or something you'd like to give a presentation on, please let us know! Also, feel free to bring code you'd like to show off or get input on from the rest of the group!

You can join the mailing list on Google Groups, or visit our website for more information.

organizer.name: Thomas Lockney
organizer.bio: Veteran software engineer and instigator. I start things. Occasionally I finish them, too.

next_event.name: Cohosted Meeting with PJUG and OSCON

name: Java Users Group of Greater Louisville
description: Everything related to software on/for the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). Java, Scala, Clojure, JavaScript, Ceylon, Kotlin, Groovy, Jython, JRuby, etc... We are enthusiasts and developers who enjoy learning about technology and sharing that knowledge.

next_event.name: Many Roads Lead To Reactive, Reactive Programming In Java

name: Functional programming Meetup
description: Сообщество разработчиков Москвы, которые уже используют или только начинают интересоваться Clojure, Erlang, Haskell, Scala, функциональными языками и функциональными подходами в программировании.

name: Java User Group Graz
description: We are a group of Java enthusiasts in the Graz area that meet on a regular basis. Everyone interested in Java and Java-related technologies is encouraged to join! We also talk Scala, Clojure and pretty much everything else that runs on a Java VM!

name: emagine - Business & IT experts
description: A group of like-minded Business & IT experts interested networking, meeting other specialists in the market and discussing all topics related to Financial Services and technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra, MongoDB, Scala, Python, Qlikview, Spotfire and Tableau.

name: Functional Rotterdam
description: Meetup focusing on Software development with Functional Programming Techniques using Scala, Clojure, Haskell etc.

organizer.name: Vijay Kiran
organizer.bio: Programmer/Philosopher.

name: CAFE: Centre Area Functional Enthusiasts
description: The Centre Area Functional Enthusiasts group is a user group for people in the Centre County region of Pennsylvania who are passionate about software development and want to learn how to apply functional programming to real world problems. We'll talk about development for the browser, mobile, and server-side. The emphasis is on professional software engineering with languages such as Scala and Clojure, but interest in others languages and platforms is also welcome.

organizer.name: Alan Effrig
organizer.bio: I just saw the group, and I think it's just what I've been looking for.  I've been hoping to find a laid-back group to have fun with some intellectual topics.

name: Chicago Heroku User Group
description: Heroku User Groups (HUGS) are a casual gatherings of developers who are interested in learning about Heroku technologies. It provides developers an opportunity to explore Heroku (a polygot platform), as well learn how to run and scale any type of app, written in Java, Ruby, Node.js, Clojure, Python or Scala. This is a great place to meet Heroku experts and network with peer.

name: HySpark (Hyderabad PySpark) Meetup
description:
This meetup group is for those interested in learning, sharing and exploring about PySpark.

Apache Spark is a lightning fast engine for large-scale data processing and the leading candidate as a successor to Map-Reduce. Spark is a general purpose in-memory cluster computing framework. Spark lazily evaluates and optimizes execution plans and smartly handles memory usage. It can run on Hadoop's resource manager and read any existing Hadoop data. It furthermore provides rich APIs in Scala, Java and Python.

PySpark is Python wrapper around Spark.

Come let's start learning about PySpark.

name: Austin Spark Users
description: This is a meetup for users of Spark (www.spark-project.org) in Austin, Texas. Spark is a high-speed Scala-based cluster programming framework which was developed at UC Berkeley. Spark is a major challeneger for Hadoop in the big data space because benchmarks show that it can outperform Hadoop by a 100x in some cases. Spark has also been accept in the Apache Incubator as of June 2013. The meetup will include introductions to the various Spark features, and case studies from current users. We will also discuss Spark related technologies,e.g., Shark.

name: 한국 Apache Spark 사용자 모임
description: Apach Spark의 활용이나 개발에 관심있는 사람들의 모임입니다.  또한, Scala 언어에 관심있는 분들의 참여 또한 환영합니다.

name: Seattle Spark Meetup
description: This is a meetup for Seattle / Eastside users of Spark (www.spark-project.org), the high-speed Scala-based cluster programming framework. We'll be rotating among locations in Seattle and Bellevue. We'll also discuss other Spark-related projects, including the Hive-on-Spark port (Shark), and other new programming tools for big data. name: Pittsburgh Functional Programming Meetup
description:
I'm probably not moving to London or the Bay Area. Is it possible to be a professional Haskell programmer in Pittsburgh? Wouldn't it be nice to have a day job slinging Erlang or Elixir?. How about getting paid to hack Clojure? Maybe your dream job is coding Common Lisp or OCaml. Is there anything we can do to promote functional programming in our town? Can we be a little less passive? If there was a visible functional community in the area, could that help to create possibilities?

With the possible exception of the multi-paradigm language Scala, I'm not sure there is a single functional programming language that's in wide enough commercial use here in Pittsburgh to support a significant work force. Likewise, potential employers might be averse to adopting FP for lack of a pool  of such developers from which to draw. But perhaps all functional languages taken together as a whole could provide a suitable foundation. It's a concurrent and polyglot world now and our industry needs what the functional paradigm has to offer.

The hope is that such a community could lower the barriers to adoption of functional languages for both employers and developers in our area.

name: OpenSource & Agile Community Events
description:
What Topics?

- Scala, F#, Haskell, Clojure, Python, Java, Ruby & C#

- Agile, Kanban, Software Craftsmanship, BDD, TDD, CI/CD

- Architecture, Microservices, CQRS, DDD

- NOSQL, Neo4J, MongoDB, Cassandra, Riak, CouchDB

- Mobile, Android, iOS, Internet of Things

- HTML5, JavaScript, NodeJS...

What kind of events?

We organise talks, meet ups, hackathons, conferences, courses and any other type of gathering that helps our community learn and share skills to write better software.

We curate content for our 'own' In-the-Brain Series, which feature the world's leading innovators and experts, who like to share their brain and inventions with you through their talks. In addition, we host approximately 40 meet up groups on a wide range of topics, who curate their own content and speakers, and which we support by providing our venue and by recording their talks as SkillsCasts, which are recordings of film, code and slides of every talk. We publish these SkillsCasts the next day, and they are free to watch for our members on our community website http://skillsmatter.com (and membership is free).

We also organise short conferences, which we call eXchanges, usually very specialised, aimed to give a certain idea, innovation or technology a 'push' by enabling a dedicated, passionate community to meet up, exchange ideas for projects, cooperation and learn.

Finally, we organise training courses, aimed at passionate enterprise developers, architects and project managers who want to learn new technologies and agile practices, straight from the source - our courses are authored and taught by well-known experts, often the creators of the course's subject.

You can find out more about Skills Matter on http://skillsmatter.com

Hope to see you at one of our events soon!

name: Lambda Luminaries
description:
Welcome to Lambda Luminaries!


We are a bunch of Functional Programming enthusiasts in and around Gauteng.

We meet in Centurion, and our members are typically based in Pretoria and Johannesburg.

We started this group in August 2011 on Google Groups. Our first physical meetup was held on Monday, September 12, 2011.

You don't have to be an expert to join us, you just need to be interested in what you read here:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_programming

We get together once a month (every second Monday of the month) to discuss functional programming concepts and languages e.g. Haskell, Clojure, Scala, Erlang etc. We also like comparing these to other languages.

Our goal is to:

    help foster and grow a healthy FP community.

    build skills by learning from each other.

    have some interesting conversations with like-minded people.

    keep the fun in functional programming.

 

We primarily use our Google Group for announcements and discussions.

Please also see our:

    LinkedIn Group

    Facebook Group

 

Hope to see you at our next meetup!

name: Barcelona Vert.x Developers
description: This meetup group is for anyone interested in using Vert.x for asynchronous, event driven applications (similar to Node.JS). Vert.x runs on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) but can execute Java, JavaScript, Scala, Python, Ruby, Groovy, Clojure, Ceylon and PHP. This means that developers using different languages can still share experiences with application architecture, and the platform in general. Basing your app on Vert.x also makes it easier to change to a different language or even mix languages in the same application as you see fit. Vert.x is an asynchronous, event (message) driven platform for applications that need to handle massive amounts of concurrent connections. You deploy components called "Verticles" on the platform. These verticles can communicate with each other internally via an event bus. Verticles can also start web servers and receive HTTP requests from the outside world. Vert.x also has support for Web Sockets for use in chat or streaming type of applications. Join the meetup and let's start playing with Vert.x ! You can check out Vert.x at http://vertx.io/ .
